result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Final pre-trial on November 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Filed by ADA Ellenwood. arc   e: Atty Satorius

8:39 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Thomas Michael Pisillo in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Thomas Michael Pisillo.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM274 (PTC) and 22CF610 (PH).  Court reviews file.  Atty Satorius states DE is willing to waive prelim today. As to 22CF610- Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Satorius state DE is okay with proceeding with ARGN today.  State to file Information that will mirror Criminal Complaint. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG. State to provide discovery within next 20 days. Request to set for Speedy Trial.  Court sets JT for 2 days. Cut off for negotiations is 11/1/22.  Adjourned at 8:49 AM. bph
Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:00 am.

8:37 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Thomas Michael Pisillo in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Thomas Michael Pisillo.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF610 (PH) & 22CM274 (PTC).  Court reviews file and notes PH set for CF case.  Atty Satorius did not know there was a prelim scheduled for today and notes he's not been appointed on newest file, asking to reschedule this PH to a later date. Court finds good cause to continue this matter. Atty Satorius states DE does qualify and would be appointed to this case as well. Atty Satorius asking to modify bond.  Court addresses bond and reviews why bond was set at $500.  Bond arguments. Court modifies bond on 22CF610. Adjourned at 8:44 AM. bph
